private_information: I can only pick and place blocks whose labels are vowels: A E I O U.
I can only interact with blocks that are currently at the top of a stack.
I can move at most one block at a time.
vowel_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that the final single stack from bottom to top is O N M L K J I H G F E D C B A.

private_information: I can only pick and place blocks whose labels are consonants: all labels except A E I O U.
I can only interact with blocks that are currently at the top of a stack.
I can move at most one block at a time.
consonant_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that the final single stack from bottom to top is O N M L K J I H G F E D C B A.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' analyses and produce a single PDDL domain and problem targeted to the FastDownwards solver that achieves the final stack O bottom through A top.

public_information: There are 15 uniquely labeled blocks: A B C D E F G H I J K L M N O.
Blocks are arranged in stacks on a table. Each stack list is given bottom to top.
Initial stacks bottom-to-top are: Stack1: C F O M H A I D G. Stack2: N K B L E J.
Both agents can only move blocks that are currently at the top of a stack.
Each agent can move at most one block at a time.
The vowel agent can move only vowel-labeled blocks A E I O U.
The consonant agent can move only consonant-labeled blocks (all other letters).
The global goal is a single stack with bottom O then N M L K J I H G F E D C B A on top.

analyze.system_prompt: You are vowel_agent. Analyze the current block configuration and your capabilities. You can only move vowels A E I O U and only top blocks one at a time. Produce a concise analysis that lists which vowel blocks are currently movable (top-of-stack), which target placements you can perform without coordinating, and any preconditions you require from the consonant agent. Do not emit PDDL. Provide your output as a structured textual plan or capability summary.
analyze.prompt: You are vowel_agent. Here is the public environment information: {environment->public_information}. Here is your private information: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. Here is your goal: {agents->vowel_agent->goal}. Produce a clear analysis of moves you can perform from the current state towards the goal, listing current movable vowel blocks, feasible immediate moves, and dependencies on consonant moves. Output a structured human-readable plan or capability description; do not output PDDL.

analyze.system_prompt: You are consonant_agent. Analyze the current block configuration and your capabilities. You can only move consonant-labeled blocks and only top blocks one at a time. Produce a concise analysis that lists which consonant blocks are currently movable, which target placements you can perform without coordinating, and any preconditions you require from the vowel agent. Do not emit PDDL. Provide your output as a structured textual plan or capability summary.
analyze.prompt: You are consonant_agent. Here is the public environment information: {environment->public_information}. Here is your private information: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. Here is your goal: {agents->consonant_agent->goal}. Produce a clear analysis of moves you can perform from the current state towards the goal, listing current movable consonant blocks, feasible immediate moves, and dependencies on vowel moves. Output a structured human-readable plan or capability description; do not output PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are orchestrator. Integrate the analyses from the two agents and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner that achieves the global goal single stack O bottom through A top. The domain must model blocks, the table, top-of-stack constraints, and two distinct agent action types labeled so their actions remain separate (for example actions prefixed with vowel- and consonant-). The PDDL output must include a domain and a problem. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>. Ensure compatibility with FastDownwards standard requirements and avoid solver-specific extensions. If inputs are partial, resolve ambiguities conservatively and keep agent actions distinct.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. Here is the public environment information: {environment->public_information}. Here are the two agents and their private information: vowel_agent: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information} consonant_agent: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. Here is the goal you must achieve: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Here is the analysis from the vowel agent: {plan_vowel}. Here is the analysis from the consonant agent: {plan_consonant}. Integrate these analyses and produce a PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that models two agent types with distinct actions and achieves the goal. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
